DOC.brief_summary: T Cell Large Granular Lymphocyte ( T-LGL ) Lymphoproliferative Disorders heterogeneous group uncommon disease may involve polyclonal monoclonal T cell population , bear characteristic surface marker correspond activate cytotoxic ( CD3+ , CD8+ ) lymphocytes . They often associate quite severe neutropenia , anemia , thrombocytopenia may life-threatening . There evidence abnormal cytotoxic lymphocyte population may cause cytopenia suppress hematopoiesis , although mechanism unclear . Case report suggest immunosuppressive therapy direct toward T cell may reverse cytopenia . This pilot study involve 25 patient evaluate clinical response cyclosporine , immunosuppressive drug , seek elucidate mechanism underlie cytopenia .

DOC.criteria: Patients must great equal 18 year age . Peripheral blood absolute LGL count great equal 300/ul ( perform manual differential ) , LGL cell characteristic appearance large lymphocytes abundant pale blue cytoplasm , without perinuclear clear zone , vary degree azurophilic granule . Immunophenotypic study peripheral blood show increased population TLGL ( Staining : CD3 , CD8 , either CD16 CD57+/ CD56 ) . Severe neutropenia ( less equal 500 neutrophils/uL peripheral blood ) , severe thrombocytopenia ( less equal 20,000 platelets/uL , moderate thrombocytopenia ( less equal 50,000 platelets/uL active bleeding , anemia ( hemoglobin less equal 9 gm/dL ) , red blood cell transfusion requirement great equal 2 units/month two month prior initiation CsA treatment . Patients must previous treatment CsA FK506 . Patients must reactive LGL lymphocytosis viral infection . Patients must ECOG performance status great 3 . Patients must currently pregnant , unwilling take oral contraceptive unless postmenopausal . Mothers must breast feeding . Patients must able give informed consent . Patients must HIV positive .
